publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2333 Dr Richard Simpson: Central Scotland Police Annual Report—That the Parliament notes the last annual report to be delivered by Central Scotland’s Chief Constable, Andrew Cameron, covering the year 2007-08 and commends him and his force on their increasing success in delivering police services and increasing community safety across central Scotland; recognises that Central Scotland Police has one of the highest detection rates in the United Kingdom at 60% and that the force is reducing crime in all three command areas, especially drug-related crime, with more than 300 dealers being charged in 2007-08, and acknowledges, in particular, Andrew Cameron’s 40 years of service and his efforts to involve communities and their representatives in tackling all manner of crimes in central Scotland.
S3M-2333 Central Scotland Police Annual Report (lodged on 16 July 2008) Jack McConnell*
S3M-2333 Central Scotland Police Annual Report (lodged on 16 July 2008) Jamie Hepburn*
